body.p: The undersigned petitioners respectfully represent that Jospeh Schwartz was at the present March Term ^on the Kenton Circuit Court^ convicted of stealing a pocket book & containing $2000 and sentenced to one year confinement in the Penitentiary the said Joseph is a youth of 14 or 15 years the son a a very worthy German Citizen of Covington Ky And we feel Confident is such a case as demands and fully justifies Executive interference The jury who Convicted him are very desirious for his pardon & respectfully ask your Excellency to grant him immediate pardon & your Petitioners will ever pray &c

Wm N Wood
S, H, Hood
John P Noonan
S H Cambron
M. J. Dudley
D. Moon
J. M. Casey
John, P. Harrison
R. M. Carlis A. G.
C M Moore
J. O'Hara Jr
W. S. Ellis
Jno E Hamilton
S C Perrin
V. T. Chambers
J. S. Scott
James K Daket

I did not hear the evidence, but the prisoner is a mere child in appearance; and as he proposes to leave the state, I think it would be well to pardon him
J. G. Carlisle

Kenton Cir. Ct
Jos. Schwartz
1 yr. Penty
